Pre-Game Insights: Bolivia made a perfect start at their new home, beating Venezuela 4-0 last month.
Bolivia's historic victory away in Chile was their first on the road in qualifying in 67 matches, since a 7-1 win against Venezuela in 1993.
The appointment of Oscar Villegas was evidently an inspired one after he joined following their Copa America elimination in the summer, starting with two wins from two.
Bolivia have one of the youngest and inexperienced squads in South America, with only one member of the squad having over 40 caps and 12 of the 28 having two or less caps.

Colombia are still unbeaten inside 90 minutes under Nestor Lorenzo, who has now taken charge of 28 games, with the extra-time defeat in the Copa America final to Argentina the only blemish on his record.
Colombia have not lost in regular time under Lorenzo, and have won on just two of their last eight visits to Bolivia.
Bolivia will be seeking a fourth win in five qualifiers, but Colombia are yet to lose in regular time under Lorenzo.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bolivia's new home venue is even higher above sea level than the infamous Estadio Hernando Siles in La Paz.
Colombia beat Argentina in their last outing, which was timed perfectly, as they went into the game on the back of an underwhelming 1-1 draw with a Peru side that sits bottom of the standings.
